business

Class TagManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • business.TagManager

  • public class TagManager
extends java.lang.Object
    this class is a collection of static methods to manage operations on XML tags assuming that the tags are part of a certain standard and therefore must comply with them (In This case PDSC Standard). So this class has the task to perform operations on tags without braking standard's rules. for every performed operations, a static listener is notified to manage adjunctive situations. NOTE : all functions in someNameManager classes change the instance of the object unlike someNameUtils classes
    Author:
    mircopalese

      • addCustomTags

        public static void addCustomTags(XmlTag tag,
                                 java.lang.String[] names,
                                 boolean registerOperation,
                                 boolean enableUserControl)
        add custom tag (custom tags are not defined in PDSC STANDARD).
        Parameters:
        tag - tag on which add custom tags
        names - array containing custom tag names
        registerOperation - set to true if you want to register operation for undo manager
        enableUserControl - set to true if you want the user to be alerted if there are choices to be made

      • addMultipleFiles

        public static void addMultipleFiles(XmlTag tagFiles,
                                    XmlTag tagFile,
                                    java.io.File[] listOfFiles,
                                    java.lang.String destinationPath,
                                    boolean registerOperation)
        Add multiple tag inside tag setting automatically "category" attribute. and destination path. NOTE if destination path is null no destination path is set for tag
        Parameters:
        tagFiles - tag on which you want to add children
        tagFile - model of tag you want to use to create children
        listOfFiles - list of file used for creating file
        destinationPath - destinationPath used for setting value in tag
        registerOperation - set to true if you want to register operation for undo manager

      • adjustTagAttributeException

        public static void adjustTagAttributeException(XmlTag tag,
                                               XmlTag parent)
        Verify tagAttribute exception, adding or removing attribute based on exception example : Tag " component " have attribute " Cvendor ", but must not be specified for a component within a bundle. for more info uncomment all System.out.println();
        Parameters:
        tag - tag on which verify exceptions

      • addTagInParent

        public static void addTagInParent(XmlTag newTag,
                                  XmlTag modelTag,
                                  XmlTag parent,
                                  boolean registerOperation,
                                  boolean enableUserControls,
                                  boolean notifyListener,
                                  java.lang.Integer index)
        Add passed tag in passed parent
        Parameters:
        tag - tag to add
        parent - parent in which adding tag
        registerOperation - set to true if you want to register operation for undo redo system
        enableUserControls - set to true if you want the user to be alerted if there are choices to be made
        notifyListener - set to true to notify listener that tagAddedEvent occurred
        index - specify index or set to null

      • pasteTagInParent

        public static void pasteTagInParent(XmlTag newTag,
                                    XmlTag modelTag,
                                    XmlTag parent,
                                    boolean registerOperation,
                                    boolean enableUserControls,
                                    java.lang.Integer index)
        paste passed tag in passed parent Same as addTagInParent above with the difference that attrArr is restored before pasting. This because for some previous exception some foundamental attributes for this tag may not be there so we need to restore attrArr to verify another time attribute exception

      • dropTagInParent

        public static void dropTagInParent(XmlTag newTag,
                                   XmlTag modelTag,
                                   XmlTag parent,
                                   boolean registerOperation,
                                   boolean enableUserControls,
                                   java.lang.Integer index)
        paste passed tag in passed parent Same as addTagInParent , but with the foundamental difference that if model tag is null (means that standard not provide dropped tag in drop target) setrequired is set to false to prevent false advertisement.
